name: tap water production, artificial recharged wells | tap water | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11648/documentation

This dataset represents production of 1 kg of tap water under pressure at facility gate, ready for distribution in network. It represents average operation of tap water using artificial recharged wells technology. Water intake is a mix of groundwater and surface water (60:40). Surface water recharge hole where it settles and is then filtered through natural soil. Water is pumped from aquifer, disinfected and pressurized for distribution. Inventory was constructed from reported chemicals, energy inputs and wastes from a single plant located in Québec covering nearly 100% of total production of tap water from this technology. 

From the intake pumping of raw surface water into the water treatment plant. 

This dataset ends with the production of tap water, at facility gate, under pressure. It includes energy for intake pumping, treatment system, lighting and heating of the building as well as the energy of the pump pressurizing water to the beginning of the network. It includes all chemicals and material added to the water during treatment and ultraviolent lamps for replacements. It excludes energy for pumping stations and water losses within the network which is included in the tap water market. Emissions to the environment occurring during the treatment and during the distribution were not considered as they are assumed negligible. Main substance in water that would be released in the environment are assumed to be considered in wastewater processes.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/36:Water collection, treatment and supply/360:Water collection, treatment and supply/3600:Water collection, treatment and supply

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: No extrapolation. Represents a single artificial recharged wells technology tap water production facility which is the only plant using this technology in the region to the authors knowledge. Thus, it is assumed to represent 98% of microstrainer treatment facility in Québec. This technology represents 0.9% of all tap water volume produced in Quebec.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Based on data collected from selected plants chosen either for their technological specificities or their production representativeness. A survey campaign was conducted in summer 2013 with 2012 as a reference year. All technologies combined, 16 distinct tap water production plants participated.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Surface water withdrawal represents average withdrawal from surveyed plants based on water production and wastewater production. Underground water intake accounts for 60% of total intake.

Extrapolated process. Used to represent treatment facility since actual square footing was provided by data supplier (650 m2 over lifetime production of facility asumming 60 years of useful life) and that treatment that occurs within building has limited infrastructure requirements: chemical dosage and ultraviolet disinfection. A pumping station was added to account for pumping equipment.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Surface water withdrawal represents average withdrawal from surveyed plants based on water production and wastewater production. Surface water intake accounts for 40% of total intake.

Extrapoled process. Used as approximation of effort for recharge hole construction. Value represents actual volume of holes which are used to artificially recharged the aquifer (31000 over lifetime production of facility asumming 60 years of useful life).
